definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: He seriously debated whether or not he should charge his tenants extra for the water.
sentences.chinese: 他认真地考虑该不该向房客们收取额外的水费。

sentences.english: They debated whether or not the landlady should charge him for the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们争论那个女房东是否应该收取他的水费。

sentences.english: I came to pay my water and gas fees.
Recently, Fan Group, Huangpu Town, the village received a very puzzled villagers high water.
sentences.chinese: 近日，黄圃镇团范村被收高价水费的村民非常不解。

sentences.english: Someone even assumes that they have the right to waste water because they pay for it so that it has nothing to do with others.
sentences.chinese: 更有甚者认为自己缴了水费就有权浪费，与他人无关。

sentences.english: Responsible for the collection work with price water rate above the plan.
sentences.chinese: 负责超计划加价水费的征收工作。

sentences.english: They can charge more for water or fertilizer, discouraging waste.
sentences.chinese: 也可以多收水费或化肥费以鼓励减少浪费。

sentences.english: The rent fees is $180 per week include all bills.
sentences.chinese: 房租每周$180，电费，水费，网费全包。

sentences.english: I come to pay my water and gas fees.
Hello, I came to pay my water and gas fees.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我来交水费和煤气费。

sentences.english: It includes water but not gas or electricity.
sentences.chinese: 包括水费，但不包括电和煤气费。

sentences.english: A︰Two-month rentals in advance and RM200 to cover the electricity and water bills.
sentences.chinese: 两个月的预付租金及200令吉覆盖电及水费。

definition: rent for a room or house
to be in arrears/to be out of credit/amount owing
to receive sth on another's behalf
property management/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3]
